Whether you need one for work, school, or play, CNET has you covered with our selections for something like the best laptops of 2022 across manufacturers, operating systems, price ranges, and categories. Several 2021 models have now been revised for 2022, with the addition of Intel's, AMD's, and Apple's M2 processors. Laptops. They seem to be everywhere. And yet, which portable computer should you get? Is it a Chromebook, another business laptop, a high-powered gaming laptop, or something else entirely? Because there are so many options, we compiled this list to help narrow your search.
Each year, we evaluate over 150 different laptops, spanning every imaginable price range and use case. We're here to help you choose the perfect computer, whether you need a powerful workstation, a rig for intense gaming, or a media center for relaxing with a movie as well as two. To be included in your Best Laptop of 2022 list, a system must receive an average rating of at least 4.5 stars throughout our evaluations and satisfy shoppers' most important requirements. When doing our reviews, we consider the device's overall build quality, usability (including the keyboard and touchpad), efficiency, battery life, and price.

1. HP Elite Dragonfly



The Dragonfly G3 has a newer, more professional look thanks to its switch from 16:9 to 3:2, and it comes with a wide variety of screen sizes to pick from.

Specification

● CPU: Intel Core i7-1185G7

● Storage: M.2 NVMe SSD, 512 GB

● Product dimensions: 11.6, 7.8, and 0.6 inches

Pros

+ Incredible 3.5K OLED screen resolution.

+ Effectiveness +Speedy operation.

+ Extremely svelte appearance.

Cons

− The use of OLED technology reduces battery life.

− Without a webcam shutter.

− There is a restricted number of available ports.


Occasionally, a laptop from a well-known company will fall far short of expectations, but that is not the norm. Unfortunately, the 2022 refresh of the HP Elite Dragonfly G3 also belongs there. There are several positive aspects to the new Dragonfly. It has a fascinating 3:2 form factor as an alternative to the standard 16:9 widescreen and is constructed with care.

It has a 12th-generation Intel processor, a huge battery for its class, and better connectivity than one might anticipate from a device with such a minimal form factor. However, it has several serious flaws that detract from the experience. The clarity of the display stands out the most. We'll get into the specifics shortly, but know that you can swap this LCD screen for a more advanced OLED panel if you want. However, the screen quality of the tested HP Elite Dragonfly G3 is inadequate.

Around its core, the keyboard and base, the aluminum chassis remains robust and sturdy. On the other hand, the lid is just as flimsy as that of the LG gram me or the Samsung Galaxy Book and can be twisted and bent with little effort. Compared to a Specter, the outer lid of this container easily warps when pressure is applied along its central axis. The Dragonfly G3's lid is less sturdy because it is lightweight and prevents Gorilla Glass from reinforcing.

In contrast to the earlier 2020 launch model, this Dragonfly G3 doesn't quite come in any flashy color variations. The modern color palette is less vibrant and more clinical. The "Dragonfly" line is starting to look too much like the standard "EliteBook" model in terms of color scheme.

2. MacBook Pro M1 13-inch



Even if they're more affordable, the M1-powered MacBook Air and 13-inch MacBook Pro from 2020 are still a good choice.

Specifications

● Storage: 256GB SSD

● Inches tall: 0.61 (1.56 cm)

● Weight: 3 kilogrammes (1.4 kg)

Pros

+ Great endurance for a battery

+ The new Mac operating system, Big Sur, is a great improvement.

+ Exceptional efficiency while running on native software

+ An easy-to-use keyboard and mouse



Cons

− There are only two USB ports.

− The lack of redesign has resulted in a stale appearance.

− Poor quality webcam.


Apple's M1 processor is causing a stir in the computing world because of the staggering improvements in speed and endurance it offers. As the M1-based iMac has just been released, there is further cause for cautious optimism about making the conversion to an M1 Mac shortly. It's not as cut-and-dry as it might appear to make the conversion to an M1-based Mac. To determine if switching to an M1 Mac is the right move, we'll review the main benefits and drawbacks of utilizing one.

The battery life of an M1-based MacBook will be noticeably longer than that of an Intel-based MacBook, so keep that in mind if you're shopping. Meanwhile, computers designed for use on a desk, such as the Mac mini and the iMac, have become more power-efficient, requiring less energy and being less prone to overheating. All users praise these qualities in M1 Macs. These features, taken individually, convince many individuals it's time to upgrade.

The performance of an M1 MacBook is typically superior to that of an Intel-based Mac. There is less chance that your computer will start to stutter or freeze after making the switch. Simply put, this allows the average user to have more browser tabs open without negatively impacting performance. The M1 Macs are substantially quicker, including starting up, waking up from sleep, and loading applications.

3. Razer Blade 14


Thin and lightweight, the Razer Blade 14 (2022) is a top-tier gaming laptop.

Specifications

● Size: 13.1 in² (84.4 cm²)

● Memory: 16GB of 4800MHz DDR5 RAM

● Webcam: HD infrared webcam integrated with Windows Hello (1080P)

Pros

+ It plays games at 1440p with no issues.

+ Allows the use of Virtual Reality Retro-Projection to lessen the occurrence of screen tearing.

+ Ultra-quick-response 165-Hz display.

Cons:

− We are constrained to a maximum of 16GB of storage space.

− When used for prolonged periods, the keyboard will overheat.

−

Thin and lightweight, the Razer Blade 14 (2022) is a top-tier gaming laptop. Compared to its larger siblings, the Razer Blade 15 and 17 (all of which are also excellent choices), this one is the family's baby. This model succeeds the Razer Blade 14 in 2021 and features an AMD Ryzen 5900 HX processor and an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 3070, or RTX 2080 graphics processing unit. The 2022 model keeps the same display options and the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 GPU option as its predecessor. However, Razer swapped out the RTX 3070 and 3080 for the RTX 3070 Ti and RTX 3080 Ti and upgraded the CPU to an AMD Ryzen 9 6900HX with DDR5 memory. The ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14 is a direct competitor to the Razer Blade 14. (2022).

Our Razer Blade 14 is an AMD Ryen 9 6900HX, the graphics processor is a discrete NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti, there are 16 gigabytes of RAM, and there is a terabyte of storage space. There are just three pre-set options available from Razer. The entry-level model has a 1080p 144Hz display and an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060. The other variants have a 1440p 165Hz display and an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti or 3080 Ti graphics card. The three variants' processing power, memory, and storage capacities are identical. The total graphics power (TGP) for all three GPUs is 100W.

As a media center laptop, the Razer Blade 14 holds its own. Its small form factor and long-lasting battery mean that you can easily bring it to the theater or take it with you on a road trip. The screen is vivid and clear, but the low contrast ratio makes blacks look muddy in low light. The speakers can go rather loud, but the sound quality is lacking, particularly in the low and mid frequencies.

4. Dell XPS 13


The XPS 13 Plus fully utilizes its thin-bezel design by providing a keyboard that extends over the entire device's width.

Specification

● Memory: LPDDR5-5200Mhz soldered memory, 16 GB.

● Storage: Samsung PM9A1 512GB M.2 PCIe 4

● Weight: 1.26 kg (2.77 lbs) (2.77 lbs)

Pros

+ Stunning visual appeal and top-notch construction.

+ In terms of usability, both the keyboard and the trackpad are fine.

+ Superior 3.5k OLED display.

Cons

− The touch bar requires much practice until it feels natural.

− Only USB-C ports and no auxiliary input are provided.

− When you get home late at night, the touch bar's always-on illumination is a major distraction.


In particular, the design of the new Dell XPS 13 Plus 9320 piques my interest. This is another example of Dell's ability to create a groundbreaking product. It was the first company to market a screen with minimal borders a few years ago. That's still available, albeit the keyboard deck has seen some wild changes this year. It's growing on me, I think. For some reason, when I use this XPS 13 Plus, I keep picturing myself using a MacBook. There are not many input/output (IO) ports on it.

Additionally, the keyboard deck meets the palm rest at a uniform height. Additionally, the trackpad functionality is built right into the palm rest, making it fully smooth. Although I had my doubts, this turned out to be effective.

Furthermore, there is the uppermost set of keys. Hotkeys and Function keys are now capacitive buttons built into the deck. It's true that they look great and perform adequately, but there is a caveat. This laptop has a wide range of setup options, which is great for someone as picky as me. Also, more robust features than any of the previous XPS 13 versions or the standard XPS 13 of the 2022 generation. The XPS 13 Plus fully utilizes its thin-bezel design by providing a keyboard that extends over the entire device's width. The laptop's design goes to remarkable lengths to eliminate any features that could detract from its slim, elegant appearance. The function keys have been eliminated and replaced with a touchpad.

5. Surface Laptop 4



Microsoft's latest Surface Laptop 4 improves upon the previous model rather than radically changing the industry.

Specifications

● Storage Space: 512GB SSD (256GB, 1TB)

● Dimensions: 12.1 x 8.8 x 0.57

● Weight: Two Pounds and Seventy-Nine Thousandths

Pros

+ Design that is both lightweight and minimal

+ Fantastic orators

+ The keyboard design is quite ergonomic.

Cons

− Lacks Adequate Ports.

− Requires an upgraded webcam.

− Distractingly large bezels.


The fourth generation Microsoft Surface Laptop seems to be an evolution rather than a revolution, as it maintains the same form factor and weight as previous Surface Laptops while adding better components. Microsoft hasn't tried to pass off the Surface Laptop as anything other than what it is, touting its superior battery life and increased processing power as its main selling points.

Our extensive time with this laptop confirms Microsoft's claims. However, our tests also reveal numerous areas where the company should improve its marketing. However, other companies like Dell and Apple have stretched the boundaries of how thin, attractive, and powerful modern ultra portable can be in the approximately two years since the launch of the Surface Laptop 3 in 2019. The Surface Tablet Laptop 4 is, without a doubt, the greatest Surface Laptop to date; nevertheless, determining whether it is the ideal laptop for you is more complicated.

The Surface Laptop 4 may be customized with beefier internals to meet your specific power requirements, with the highest-end configurations of each model costing as much as $2,299 but rather $2,399, respectively. Unlike its forerunners, the Surface Laptop 4 may be outfitted with either an Intel 11th Gen Core i5/i7 or just an AMD Ryzen 5/7 4000-series processor. However, the 15-inch model is limited to the more powerful Core i7/i7 CPUs. The Core i7 processor, 16GB of RAM, and 512GB solid-state drive (SSD) in our $1,699 13.5-inch Surface Laptop 4 review model are all new to the Surface Laptop line from Microsoft.
